title: @RIOT, Confusion in the Item Actives
body:
Hey guys, I was playing ARAM today and was looking at the items Sterak's Gage {{item:3053}} , and Maw of Malmortius {{item:3156}}. Interestingly, both of these items have the _"Unique Passive-Lifeline"_. I thought it was confusing how the name was the same yet the passives were different. I wondered if either they should have different names, or if together they apply at the same time. 

Please let me know. I have a feeling that the passive names are supposed to be different since both items do different effects.

Thanks guys!

replies.body:
Hey Roll,

They are meant to have the same passive name because they are both Lifeline type interactions or same unique passive family. By that, they give you a shield or boost that is suppose to help you in a panic moment or when you need your life saved... by a lifeline. 

The buffs they give are actually called something different, enraged for Maw and I think Sterak's Fury for Steraks. 

The reason this came to be was a popular build was Steraks and Maw at the same time because they did proc together and it made champions really strong and very difficult to kill.

So to sum up, they do different things but are in the same family of Lifeline Passive. Hope that clears up some stuff :D


-Ranger XIV

By the way, why is the new Athene's passive not simply named the same as the Mikael's passive, as per the usual rules for named passives?

Instead, it has a different name entirely, but it explicitly states that it disables Mikael's. It's a bit strange...

Here's a breakdown for you

* Unique Passive
 * Buying identical items will not stack the passives. 
 * For example, buying {{item:3114}} {{item:3114}} ***will not*** give you +20% CDR, + 16% Heals/Shields, it'll only give you the benefit for one
* Unique Passive - *passive name*
 * Passives with that name will not stack
 * For example, buying {{item:1001}} {{item:3006}} {{item:3009}} {{item:3158}} {{item:3020}} {{item:3047}} ***won't*** stack movement speed, because the passive name is the same even though the items are different. 
 * In cases where you do buy duplicates (for whatever reason) the strongest version is applied. So with the boots, you should have {{item:3117}} out of combat and {{item:3009}} in combat (I haven't double checked that, please don't try it in a game.)

The same concept holds true for Actives and Auras as well.

Another example is the sheen line, {{item:3057}} {{item:3078}} {{item:3100}} {{item:3025}} If you buy all of these items the spellblade passive will be applied ONLY by the one which is the strongest (most damage) at the time which will depend on the rest of your build. Stacking armor? Get the iceborn version of the passive. Stacking AP? Get the lich bane version, etc....

It'll still apply the iceberg slow, and AOE

Just had to test it in the practice tool, can confirm. 

TIL.

Yeah, it's because Iceborn actually has TWO passive, it's just merged into one for formatting issues.

It has the Spellblade passive for the bonus damage on autos, same line as Sheen.
It ALSO has the Icy passive for the Slow, same line as Frozen Mallet.

I don't remember off the top of my head how the interaction works with Mallet, I usually don't stack them, since the whole point of having the same name is to push you NOT to stack them.

Some awesome examples in here, thanks for helping out with this :D

i've been told that there was once a time before unique actives when people did this.
someone told me he bought 5 sunfires on evelynn and killed people from stealth by walking near them
Yup, that was a thing. Not for too long but it was a thing!

Only one will apply at a time.
The second one will wait untill it's condition gets fulfilled indepentantly.
Unique passives don't stack, so only one will go off. Way back early in the game, there wasn't such a limitation; imagine stacking sunfire capes and black cleavers, silly times indeed.
